2447.verse: Thus, [O Muhammad], We relate to you from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us the Qur'an.

2448.verse: Whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden,

2449.verse: [Abiding] eternally therein, and evil it is for them on the Day of Resurrection as a load -

2450.verse: The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.

2451.verse: They will murmur among themselves, "You remained not but ten [days in the world]."

2452.verse: We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in manner will say, "You remained not but one day."

2453.verse: And they ask you about the mountains, so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast.

2454.verse: And He will leave the earth a level plain;

2455.verse: You will not see therein a depression or an elevation."

2456.verse: That Day, everyone will follow [the call of] the Caller [with] no deviation therefrom, and [all] voices will be stilled before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].

2457.verse: That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.

2458.verse: Allah knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, but they do not encompass it in knowledge.

2459.verse: And [all] faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. And he will have failed who carries injustice.

2460.verse: But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.

2461.verse: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid [sin] or it would cause them remembrance.
